author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Open House London offers behind-the-scenes of London's architectural gemsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Open House London offers behind-the-scenes of London’s architectural gems Published on : Tuesday, September 15, 2015
Take a sneaky peek behind-the-scenes of some of London’s architectural gems as hundreds of buildings throw open their doors for Open House London from 19 September 2015 to 20 September 2015. Explore amazing buildings that are not usually open to the public, including 10 Downing Street and the private homes of the rich and famous.
More than 700 free guided tours, architectural-themed walks, cycle rides, debates and activities are available during the weekend.
Explore iconic buildings that are not usually open to the public, find out interesting details about more familiar spaces, and step into the private homes of the rich and famous.
Go behind the residence of the British Prime Minister, enjoy a talk followed by a rotation on the Coca-Cola London Eye, tour the Bank of England and more.
History enthusiasts will enjoy visiting the only remaining home and grade I listed Georgian house of Benjamin Franklin, discovering some of the capital’s best Roman remains at the Billingsgate Roman House and Baths and learning about the architecture and design of Kensington Palace.
For sports fans, Lee Valley VeloPark’s velodrome, a permanent venue of the London 2012 Olympics, opens its doors and a guided walk of Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park is on offer.
You can also enjoy a tour of the New Covent Garden Flower Market, talks at the Old Royal Naval College and a look behind the scenes at the National Theatre.
Tours and talks are free, but arrive early as there are usually queues to see popular buildings.
